clinical_study.brief_title: Time Window for Early Mobilization After Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Time Window for Early Mobilization in Improving Prognostic Outcomes in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke: a Pragmatic, Multi-center, Randomized Controlled, Clinical Trial

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Early mobilization was thought to be effective in patients with acute ischemic stroke. As the essential component of stroke unit care, early mobilization has already been part of routine clinical practice. However, it is uncertain that which and when medical service focusing on functional recovery should be delivered after the emergency interventions for stroke. Besides, the optimal time window, for delivering early mobilization after acute ischemic stroke, has not been verified with strong evidence.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: The primary objective of the TwEmAIS trial is to investigate the optimal time window for delivering early mobilization in improving the neurologic impairment and functional recovery in patients with acute ischemic stroke. Secondary objectives are to evaluate the efficacy of early mobilization on disability level after stroke, activity of daily living (ADL), cognitive ability, hospital LOS and cost-effectiveness.
Study design: a pragmatic, investigator-initiated, multi-center, randomized controlled, clinical trial.
Sample size: 1500 cases
According to the function evaluation of each patient, the corresponding rehabilitation treatment was arranged.
Statistical analysis: Statistical analysis was performed with SPSS 23.0. One-way analysis of variance was used to compare statistical differences between the groups (5 time points) and between groups (3 intervention groups).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients with acute ischemic stroke fulfilling the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be randomly allocated to either 1) the very early rehabilitation (VER) group where early mobilization initiates within 24h from the onset of the disease, 2) the relative early rehabilitation (RER) group where early mobilization initiates between 24-72h or 3) the early rehabilitation (ER) group where early mobilization initiates after 72h.
study_design_info.masking_description: Pre-admission trial assistants and medical staff aware of group allocation will not have contact with the patients. At each study site, a group of physiotherapists will be responsible for the interventions for all three study groups. Multi-disciplinary physicians, assessors, data analysts, and statisticians will be blinded to the group allocation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: the total score of NIHSS will be recorded 3 months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
primary_outcome.description: National Institute of Health stroke scale，total scores range from 0 to 42, higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the total score of Barthel Index will be recorded 15days、1month、3 months、6months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: ability of daily living, total scores range from 0 to 100, higher values represent a better outcome and independent living ability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the degree of modified Rankin Scale will be recorded 15days、1month、3 months、6months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: modified Rankin Scale, to evaluate a subject's disability status. It's a rating data. The degrees range from 0 to 6, higher values represent a worse outcome and severe disability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the total score of MMSE will be recorded 15days、1month、3 months、6months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: Mini-mental State Examination. To evaluate a subject's mental state.The total score range from 0 to 30, higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the total score of NIHSS will be recorded15days、1month、6months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: National Institute of Health stroke scale，total scores range from 0 to 42, higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The incidence of important medical events will be recorded 15days、1month、3 months、6months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: falls, trauma, fracture, syncope, epilepsy, pneumonia, atelectasis, venous thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, pressure sores, death, etc.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital LOS will be recorded 3 months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: length of stay in the acute hospital and in the rehabilitation hospital, and total hospital length of stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: medical cost will be recorded 3 months after the cerebrovascular accident/or the last time appeared normally
secondary_outcome.description: addition of the cost of each admission of the acute hospital and the rehabilitation hospital

intervention.description: The three study groups share a same intervention protocol in addition to the initiation timing of intervention from the stroke onset. The frequency and intensity of the intervention is titrated according to functional activity baseline and monitored daily and adjusted with recovery. Encourage patients to move out of bed as soon as possible. Definition of bed movement: Encourage and help patients to perform functional actions, focusing on activities such as sitting, standing, walking out of the bed.
